review.title: not worth the money, don't bother

review.title: My entire family had food poisoning!!!!
review.reviewText: Horrible experience! We booked a room with two queen beds and we ended up getting a very strange smelly room with one king bed. The staff did not care when I asked why they change our room. They were very laid back, rude and the did not care at all to provide the minimum required service. We orders room service, we left almost all our food since it was horrible. We got all sick that night expect my husband who did not eat. Stay away from this hotel it is horrible. I usually stay at Marriots, but this one only carries the name not the quality associated with the brand. It is not a hotel , it is a nightmare!!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Absolutely everything starting with the staff and management.
review.locationRemarks: Horrible neighbourhood, not very safe.

review.title: Worth it.

review.title: Good location for visiting San Fran. & San Jose
review.reviewText: Good restaurant and room service. The menu isn't large but all the food is excellent. After a busy day, nice to relax with an in-room movie and room service dinner. Good parking, though pricey. Sprawling hotel layout takes some acclimation.

review.title: Conveniently  located.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Staff very professional  and knowledgeable  of area attractions. With the exception of the $25 breakfast I would recommend. Big room, big bathroom. Pool is nice, Sana was awesome!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Tamara,

As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for your overall experience with us. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that these were isolated issues that are corrected moving forward. 

Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to San Mateo. 

Best Regards,

Michelle A.
Operations Manager, At San Mateo Marriott San Francisco Airport

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText:
The halls were a mess with litter and debris, dirty carpeting.  The dining room was mediocre at best.  It was cafeteria style, not at all comfortable dining, and the food was nothing at all special but priced like a five star.  I booked it on line hoping to treat my family to something special.  The only thing extraordinary were the prices.  
There was a used tampon on the sidewalk by pool.  I reported it to house keeping, it was still there the next day.  Gross.  
Staff seemed tired and not very happy- work as usual.  Overall disappointing experience!!!
review.positiveRemarks:
The picture on the Expedia site.  It looks so much better in picture than it does in person.  
The sheets were very white.  Room was clean.
review.negativeRemarks:
See the above :  Staff could be happier, friendly, attentive to details.  
Dining room / Cafe needs a face lift and price drop.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.  Eat at Mimi's!  YUM!

review.title: would not come back
review.reviewText: The room is really old and not clean.   Front receptionists r not that friendly.  I have to fight with her about the charges.  Overall.  It was not a pleasant experience

review.title: Nice hotel!
review.reviewText: I had a great experience at the hotel. Traveled for business and it had a great location close to the bay, airport and only a 40 minute drive to San Francisco. I would recommend this to hotel to anyone. The California Grill located inside the hotel is also a great place to eat.

review.title: Helpful staff
review.reviewText: My first room the ac did not work. I was miserable the first night. They sent someone up to fix and it seemed like it was a common problem. Then room smelt weird. So I asked to change. Very nice and quickly sent staff up to help me move. The new room was perfect temp. Older rooms but nicely kept. my second room didn't seem as clean as the first however. I picked several items off carpet and even used a wipe to clean desk off. Staff was great but rooms need a redo.

A good experience for me and my daughter 
Only thing was it took over an hour for out food at the cafe but it was busy

I have a back to back reservation (2 nights + 1 additional night). They did not make up the room after my first reservation. I came back late after a,long day with empty supplies in the bathroom. Terrible room service. Will recommend my company never to choose this hotel again.

review.title: 2nd time
review.reviewText:
This was our second time at this hotel
And was a bit taken back .... Worn down furnishing and extremely heavily stained carpet 
Last visit our suite was more on the newer and fresher side

review.title: A very nice place close to home.
review.reviewText: Just stayed overnight, had a nice meal at the California Grill.
review.negativeRemarks: They shouldn't have a parking charge.
review.locationRemarks: It's close to downtown San Mateo and the 101 freeway.

review.reviewText: Hotel staff very friendly. Hotel needs to upgrade heating/cooling system, the RATTLING, CLUNKING NOISE it made was unbearable causing us never to turn it on.

review.title: Nice hotel, a lot of hidden fees
review.reviewText:
They charge $24 per day for parking,
No free WiFi in the room. 
The hotel was nice, but I don't like hidden fees,there should be an option for you to add them on at booking.

review.title: Comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a few nights after selling my condo in the area. Wanted something comfortable and convenient while I was tying up loose ends before I moved out of state. Rooms were clean, bed was very comfortable and staff was nice. Wifi was a bit spotty at times but I managed.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is a little too expensive especially for the property.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown San Mateo is a mile away, lots of different kinds of restaurants. Hillsdale mall is close as well.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Services at conceirge lounge were great. Staff was very helpful and went out of their way to make the stay comfortable.
Terrible pillows. AC was blowing cigarette smoke into my room at 4am, woke me up. Terrible night of (not) sleeping.
review.negativeRemarks: Terrible pillows. AC was blowing cigarette smoke into my room at 4am, woke me up. Terrible night of (not) sleeping.

review.reviewText: Arrived on time and I was able to get into my room early. Staff was great and room was nice.

review.title: Nice clean hotel, very quiet
review.reviewText: Very convenient to SFO. Courtesy shuttle to airport and back. Nice pool area.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Trader JOES, tjmaxx and Ross

review.reviewText: Hotel was really nice with no real problems anywhere.  Expedia got us a very good rate, too.

Went for a wedding reception, which was fun and beautiful. But the room we got was just ok. I found a hair on my towel in the bathroom from a previous guest, which grossed me out, and as long as I didn't look too closely at anything the cleanliness level was ok. Cleanliness could use improvement, things were generally clean, but worn out and in need of a deeper cleaning (sinks and showers had traces of black mildew in harder to reach spots). And a second look to see if towels are hair free please! But honestly I'd give it a C+ overall. Service was great though. They gave us water on our way out and the guy who helped us into our room was really nice.

review.title: Awesome business hotel.
review.reviewText: Great staff, good food and great location for business and close to SFO. I will definitely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was excellent. Clean and spacious rooms. You cannot go wrong with Marriott.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking a bit pricey.
review.locationRemarks: Half Moon Bay is close - worth the trip!

review.reviewText: love it nice location easy to get to downtown San Fran
Staff attended to all my needs. Nice comfortable room and beds. If i come back to San Fransisco I will come back to this hotel.

There is no interent no parking you have to pay for them.

I thougt it will be a nice very clean hotle but it is not like what I thought. It is also far from the  tourist  Places in  San Francisco.
It was okay if you just need a place to sleep a night or two

review.title: San Fran in august 2015
review.reviewText: We have stayed in other hotels in the area for the same price and this hotel exceeded our expectations (not to thrilled about the $20 parking) breakfast included served to your table!! , more than worth the $20 parking. Would recommend to everyone, easy and close to all the main attractions in SF.!!!

review.title: Ideal to commute between San Francisco & San Jose

review.negativeRemarks: Beds.  The beds are OK, but too soft for me.

My room was also extremely noisy due to some..."internal machinery" somewhere in the walls that made a very loud noise regularly.
review.positiveRemarks: the location is convenient -yet unpleasant as between highways: 101 and 92-.

review.title: Clean, easy access from freeway
review.reviewText: I was first issued a room on the ground floor overlooking the pool...you definitely could hear the hooting and hollering of people/kids having a good time at the pool. I chose to switch rooms as I wanted a quieter room for my infant to nap. They happily accommodated my request with an upgrade. The room was very clean and very quiet. I was unaware of the onsite parking fee...$24 day I think. Overall the staff was extremely nice and helpful.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for taking the time to share your feedback with us! Wi-Fi is free for Marriott Rewards Members and it takes minutes to sign up at the Front Desk. Also, pay close attention to your rate..there are lots of additional fees that are quite pricey like Wi-Fi and parking.

review.title: Everything went wrong
review.reviewText:
The hotel did not honor my request for two double beds and only had a king suite, which was not comfortable for our teens.  The whole hotel was supposed to be nonsmoking but the room and parts of the hotel smelled badly of smoke.  The carpet was dreary and dated.  They did not give us the breakfast tokens when they were supposed to be included and though the food was good ion the morning the service was slow.

Generally, the hotel is not well managed and it is not family friendly.  Finally, the area is very ugly.

review.title: Spring break 2015
review.reviewText: Stay was great. Convienent location. Great staff. Clean rooms. Quiet.

review.title: Definitely staying at the Marriott again
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice the staff was very helpful and friendly since you walked in through the doors. One thing I was not happy with was when we got to our room I used the restroom and the toilet was not properly cleaned  their was dry urine, I was disgusted, I had to clean it my self . Other than that the hotel was a good choice.
Beautiful room in an upgrade.  Couldn't have been more happy.
review.locationRemarks: Near Burlingame and other small towns with a lot to offe.r

review.reviewText: The room was very warm and I never could get it to cool down. Other than that the room and hotel are very nice.

review.title: Great location on Peninsula

review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant staff good but prices a bit high for breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Not the greatest of neighborhoods but close to San Mateo and the Elks club

review.reviewText: Great place and close to everything I needed in the San Mateo area

review.title: Room to small
review.reviewText: For a deluxe room. This was very small. And tbe fact that we were tbere only for one nite was not a good reason to have got that room like the person at the front desk said.or maybe because we book it thru expedia.

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText:
Very prompt and attentive check in.
Nice big room with comp upgrade 
Shouldn't have to pay to self park outdoors.

review.positiveRemarks: The bedding/linen was great and bed very comfy
review.locationRemarks: lots to do within 15-30 min. main SF sites

review.title: Very quiet hotel. Nice rooms.
review.reviewText: Arrived to find multiple wedding party's in the lobby. That was a bit chaotic, but the staff handled our check in quickly. After that, we never heard from any of the other guests. It's a very quiet hotel, with modern, clean rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Not a lot near by. We ended up driving about 10 minutes away to south San Francisco.  Still had a great stay. Conveniently close to the SFO airport.

review.reviewText: Great location not far from local downtown with great eateries.

review.title: Good but not that close to San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText:
This was a pleasant hotel, with large rooms and an extensive footprint (i.e. long corridors but not many floors).  The room was comfortable and clean though it didn't have a fridge.  

It's about 15 minutes ($30 by taxi) from the airport.  The shuttle bus to/from the airport only provides an hourly service.  We were returning by hire car, so that wasn't a problem, but I wouldn't group hotel with the other ones that are much closer to San Francisco airport and have more frequent shuttle buses.
review.locationRemarks: 5-10 minutes' drive from a range of excellent shops and restaurants in San Mateo.

review.title: Nice hotel. Charge to much for parking
review.reviewText:
Nice place great staff, comfortable rooms.  
25 dollars a day parking and not a secure lot is a little steep, but still would recommend to anyone.

review.title: Honeymoon stay
review.reviewText: It was a great experience. They upgraded us to a suite and paid out parking. Then on the second day when we came home from a long say out they had left us champagne and strawberries. They were also great in recommending places to see and eat at.

review.title: Unexpected trip
review.reviewText:
My husband and I made a last minute decision to stay overnight after a memorial service.   The week had been very stressful.  

After arriving late to the hotel we found out that our roon was an up-grade. 
We were delighted to find the hotel clean and well run. The bed was so comfortable. We both got a good nights sleep.  

The breakfast buffet was very good.  The wait staff was friendly and provided excellent service.

We were pleased with our last minute decision to stay at the San Mateo Marriott.
review.positiveRemarks: The comfortable bed.  The breakfast buffet was very good.

review.title: Marriott San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: All in all I had a pleasant stay, the staff was very friendly both at the front desk and in the restaurant My only real complaint and it's a minor one is that the seat in the restroom was kind of on the cheap side and not very comfortable but other than that not bad.
Very nice hotel, I would definately stay here again if I could!! And I probably will

review.title: Nice hotel near the airport
review.reviewText:
We had a nice stay, the room was spacious and big but for some reason we couldn't add a rollaway bed to our room.  I had asked for 2 queen beds and a sofa bed because I had 3 kids plus my husband and I and I specified it in my reservation and I ended up in a King size bed and sofa but the 3rd kid had to sleep in the bed with us. Not very comfortable.

The hotel was nice, clean and with lots of amenities.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient, well located with easy access to highways.

review.title: weekend retreat
review.reviewText: It is a good place to stay away for the weekend, It is very much what u would expect to stay in one of the chained hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: U have a choice either park in their paid parking lot or just find a spot outside on the street for no cost
review.negativeRemarks: very much it is what it is.

review.title: Running Toilet
review.reviewText: The toilet would run every half hour.  Notified the desk, but nothing was done about it.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs more elevators.

review.reviewText: it was a very nice stay at the hotel, i certainly feel I got more than the value paid

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Marriott for three days, we were mostly out of the hotel during the day time. But when we were there the facilities like the pool and the cardio center were really clean and easily accessible. We also enjoyed the discount on parking, the cost of parking was quiet expensive so $11 dollars a day was not bad. As well the staff was able to accommodate our group of 5 people comfortably in a bigger room than what we had booked. Overall we will come back to the Marriott.
review.positiveRemarks: I really like the workout rooms and the swimming pool, they were really clean. As well the discount on the parking and how affordable the hotel was.
review.negativeRemarks: The free Wi-fi, would make this hotel even better

review.title: Very nice hotel close to the SF airport
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable room, excellent breakfast buffet. Would recommend to anyone who need accommodation close to the airport.
No ventilation in the sleeping area of the room and bathroom. Exposed wires in an outlet in the bathroom

review.title: Great Hotel in San Mateo
review.reviewText: Stayed here for two nights with the family.  Lovely large room with a king sized bed in a separate bedroom and a pull out sofa in the living area.  The kids enjoyed the outdoor pool and hot tub.  Quiet hotel, with comfortable beds.  We had to pay for wifi and parking.   The breakfast buffet was outstanding - lots of choices and an omelette station.

review.title: Clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, I was impressed and I have high expectations.

review.title: Definitely don't judge a book by its cover.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was excellent and exhibited great customer service.  The hotel looked great and appeard to be very clean.  However, the duvet on the bed was stained and dirty.  The stain were large and were definitely x-rated.  I called guest services for clean linens, which was provided with apologies.  However, you would definitely note expect to find dirty, stained linens on your bed in a hotel of the calibre.  I took photos of the stained duvet, if the hotel management is interested in seeing.  Based on this experience, I have nothing further to add under the categories below.
Friendly atmosphere. Very comfortable and relaxing.
perfect location for visiting San Francisco.  Would stay there again.

review.title: Beautiful hotel near 101 freeway
review.reviewText:
The hotel is beautiful and the room was nice and clean. Amenities and equipments were all there and efficient. My daughter enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi.

My only complaint is that they charge 22 dollars a day for parking. Considering it's not so conveniently placed from public transportation, it seemed odd. But then it may be fair pricing for those who don't need parking.

review.title: Executive suite
review.reviewText: The room wasn't ready at the 3:00. Check In. The manager on duty was very attentive offered drinks and desserts. They also stored a large birthday cake in the restaruant kitchen for us.

review.title: Some dropped balls
review.reviewText:
Had reservation for 4 adults, they'd apparently planned to put us into a room with one king sized bed. They put us into a room with two double beds (or narrow queen-sized beds?) that was set up for 2 occupants. We had to ask for towels and K-cup coffee pods for 4. The usual not-very-disclosed wireless and parking fees were annoying. I wish Expedia would show prices with our selected set of options to simplify total cost comparison.

The card reader at the door we chose to park near didn't work. The room's mini-fridge door didn't close, reducing cooling considerably. Otherwise no real problems. Basically, nicely furnished etc. and not visibly aging but attention to details lacking.

The front desk Indian accents were rather strong and hard to understand.

The hotel location is a bit awkward, one really needs GPS to get to it from the San Francisco direction. We also did not follow GPS heading to SFO for fear of missing a turn and ending up crossing the bridge.

review.title: Over Priced
review.reviewText: I felt the rates and amenities were very overpriced for this older hotel. The cheapest thing on their breakfast menu was $6 and that was for a glass of juice. Parking and wifi were pricey as well. I felt like I could have spent the same amount and stayed at a nicer place.

review.title: OK hotel, but ridiculously expensive
review.reviewText: Perhaps I am just cheap, but paying $4.37 for a 20 oz. bottle of soda seems out of line to me. This hotel sits in the middle of nowhere, leaving you stuck paying the lobby prices for things like that, and there are no nearby restaurants that I could see in my 3 days there. However, the beds were comfortable and the room was clean.

review.title: Wonderful hotel.
review.reviewText: This was a great place to stay during out vacation. Friendly staff and a beautiful facility. The only complaint I have is the wifi is expensive.

review.title: Convenient and central located. Close to freeways
review.reviewText: Friendly staff. Close to freeways. I would return.

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText:
Would of liked earlier check in
Needed a little maintenance bed, tub tap toilet ran.

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: Bathroom could be upgraded as the bathtub has scratches and look yellowish.
review.negativeRemarks: See above comments about bathtub.
review.locationRemarks: SF cultural activities, Golden gate Park, Stanford University, Half Moon Bay

review.title: Beware of undisclosed charges
review.reviewText: Hotel was ok not as expected had to keep calling for towels daily. Watch for charges they tell you to accept charges per room for wifi then it turns out to be per device. Parking was too much. Everything single move you do had a charge. A hotel nearby was cheaper no wifi fee or Peking fee. So please research

review.title: Maintenance is lacking
review.reviewText: Plumbing problems, dirty sinks, no water pressure in the shower and cleaning staff loudly knocking on everyone's door at 800 am Sunday morning are just some of the problems experience on this trip. We have stayed here before and had good experiences so I hoping this is just a lapse in care and that they we'll take steps to correct these deficiencies.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, comfortable beds, quiet rooms.

review.title: Nice and clean!
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for the SF 1/2 Marathon. The room was very clean and the staff was helpful and friendly.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Pleasant staff, clean room, easy check out and not too shabby room service. My only complaint was that dirty dishes remained in the hallway outside of rooms for hours on end. It's just not pleasant repeatedly walking past them to and fro ones room. Also, there were no stocked towels out by the pool. Otherwise, I recommend this hotel.

review.title: Amazing hotel and staff!
review.reviewText: The room was big and nice! Great view, staff, and they were very accommodating. Room service was perfect! I would stay here every time.

review.title: Hotel near seminar
review.reviewText: Room was nice. Quiet. Business center allowed me to print out some last minute maps, etc. But what irritated me more than anything was parking was not free!
review.negativeRemarks: The staff did not inform me that parking cost $22 per day/night. When I booked the room it was not stated nor when I arrived for check in.

review.title: superb service
review.reviewText: Some person in our adjacent room decided to smoke (this is a smoke free facility).. they quickly moved us to another room, and not only just another room, but upgraded us to a loft !!!

review.title: Marriot Hotel
review.reviewText: Elevator doors got stuck on me. Bathtub had private part hair in it. Couches were a little firm. Short stays might be ok but long term would be very uncomfortable.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: We arrived a bit later than we had expected so we had to change quickly to attend an event. I quickly wetted my hair only to find that the hair dryer didn't work, we waited a bit then had to go. The next morning I tried to make coffee and the coffee maker didn't work, not good. I did go to the front desk to complain and the very nice gal at the front desk gave me to vouchers for two cups of Starbucks coffee. We are timeshare owners through Marriott, and have a ton of points so we have stayed at many Marriott properties, this was the worst. I also thought it was the one at the airport as is says Marriott airport on the web so we were also disappointed with the location. We would not stay there again. Carolyn Trecartin

review.title: Hotel is in very good conditions
review.reviewText: Hotel is about 20 minutes away from downtown San Francisco. Hotel staff was great and the room conditions was great.

review.title: Great all around!
review.reviewText: The staff was great from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. The proximity to SFO and the train were perfect. I'll be staying there again on my next trip.

review.title: Location was key to me
review.reviewText: I was disappointed that there were no towel racks in the room ...only one hook in bath room. If you want to conserve energy and wash the towels less then we need a place to hang them.

managementResponses.response: We are extremely excited to receive your 5 star rating and to hear that you will always stay at our hotel! Thank you for your kind remarks on our great staff and clean hotel. Our staff works very hard to keep our guests happy and our property spotless. Again, thank you for your review.

review.title: GREAT STAY
review.reviewText:
Very nice staff and such a clean place to stay.
We will always stay at this hotel

managementResponses.response: Thank you for allowing us to accommodate you. We are very happy to receive your excellent rating and review, and look forward to your return to enjoy our hotel again, as well as all of our amenities! Thank you for your review.

review.title: Huge room with room for two couples
review.reviewText: Wished we knew about the great facilities. We were there for an off site wedding. Should have saved some time to workout in the huge gym or swim or hot tub.
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable bed. Giant room. Great for adult son to have lots of room in the living room.

managementResponses.response: We apologize and regret not having the opportunity to make things right while you were still our guest. Please know that we are always available to assist our guests and are happy to do all we possibly can to ensure their comfort. If there are any other specifics that you would like to further discuss, please do not hesitate to call our hotel. We appreciate your feedback and time in completing the review.

review.title: very noice room I can not sleep
review.reviewText: I stay at room # 1105 . It was very noice all the time. elevator plum noice. air condition fan motor noice. water noice. you better to always keep check it.

review.title: First family vacation!!
review.reviewText: I was nervous about traveling with two kids. I'm happy to say that this hotel was incredibly accommodating!! The staff was amazing and very helpful!!!! The room was wonderfully clean and spacious!! I'm very happy and will stay here again in a heartbeat!

review.title: The service was horrible.
review.reviewText: Horrible service and the rooms are not accurate to the description.

review.title: Very friendly and helpful staff made the trip
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay. The facilities were nice and the staff was excellent! The children were welcome guest and didn't want to leave. There was a slight mix up about some changes we'd made to our reservation, but after seeing the email confirmation, there was no problem. We'd gladly visit there again!
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful and spacious and yet a feel of quaint intimacy.
review.negativeRemarks: There were some stains on the carpet in one of the rooms and there weren't enough towels for each of the adults originally. Quickly corrected.
review.locationRemarks: Near major freeway and major attractions. There was access to a lot of eating establishments within a reasonable distance. Some nearby shopping.

managementResponses.response: Our staff is very excited to receive your wonderful compliments on our hotel and helpful customer service. It is always our pleasure to assist you in any way we possibly can to make your stay a comfortable and enjoyable one. Please know that our parking fee for secured parking on our property is commensurate with the majority of brand hotels in our area. Thank you for staying at the San Mateo Marriott San Francisco Hotel.

review.title: It was a very nice stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was really nice. We enjoyed the staff, they were very helpful and fast. The only thing we can complain about was that they make you pay to park in the secured parking at the hotel. The only free parking is located at the back of the hotel on the street.
review.negativeRemarks: Making the guests pay to park. They need to stop making paying customers to park in the secure parking lot.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for recommending our breakfast to other Expedia travelers! We are glad you enjoyed it and hope you will be back to enjoy more of the same. Thank you for your review.

review.title: Hotel was okay
review.reviewText: breakfast was wonderful. If you book through expedia, you should pay the breakfast included price. Definitely worth it.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking could have been cheaper. Internet was 10 per device.
review.locationRemarks: No places nearby to eat. 5 minutes from Costco though

managementResponses.response: It's wonderful to receive your positive review and excellent rating on your experience. We loved hearing that you enjoyed clean accommodations, comfortable beds and friendly service. Thank you! We can't wait to have you back!

review.title: Great room!
review.reviewText: Room was very clean, beds were really comfortable and staff was super nice. We will be back!
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were great. Bathroom was clean and the room was very spacious.
review.locationRemarks: We were there for a SF Giants game. It was about a 20 minute drive but it's all freeway. I will gladly drive it again the next game we go to.

managementResponses.response: We certainly appreciate you sharing with other Expedia travelers all that you enjoyed about your experience with us. Thank you for your kind words on our friendly staff, clean property and great amenities. We do apologize that our shuttle hours did not accommodate your departure. Thank you for your understanding. We hope your party of 6 will keep in mind all the was enjoyed and choose to stay with us again.

review.title: Nice hotel for party of 6.
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean, friendly staff, nice pool and hot tub in courtyard. Restrauant had good food for reasonable prices. Only drawback was advertised free airport shuttle. Our flight left at 6am and shuttle didn't start until 5am. We spent $45 on a taxi to get to the airport.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing in walking distance from the hotel.

review.title: Nice place and good area
review.reviewText: It was good but I needed bathroom to be in the living room to have more privacy but that wasn't the case.

review.title: Cozy
review.reviewText: Clean rooms, great pool. Perfect for my family and I - just needed one night in a nice hotel near the SFO airport.

review.title: Attractive, clean, accommodations.
review.reviewText: Stayed for two nights visiting family in the area. Attractive lobby and rooms, well kept, and clean. Comfortable beds with plenty of pillows. Great service. No complaints at all.
review.positiveRemarks: Felt safe, comfortable, and convenient location.
review.locationRemarks: Central to San Francisco and airport, and San Jose.

review.title: Good business hotel
review.reviewText: Overall ok but front desk staff needs training. I have been charged $50 erroniously and I have to still claim it back. When I extended the room, rate was charged very high, after checking in I was asked to come again to the desk on card issue. Ultimately, i paid cash yet money was charged on the card that i gave them as alternate. Its a mess
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk and quality of customer care
review.locationRemarks: I had come there for function so was busy with that. Stanfoerd University, Sandhill area quite close by where I had business to attend.

review.title: Central hotel to our day trips
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel that is conveniently located near the airport, but also a short distance to downtown SF, San Jose and Palo Alto. We've stayed here a number of times over the past few years and enjoy a consistent, excellent experience.

review.title: Fine place to stay
review.reviewText: Stayed here to be close to the SF airport. Clean pleasant, decent workout facilities and pool/hot tub.

review.title: Great hotel and friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Great!!! The experience was phenomenal... The room service was kind and friendly. The valley parking was excellent you just dial zero on the phone and your car is waiting for you when you come down stairs.

review.title: Fine, Not Good, but Fine.
review.reviewText:
Staff were great, outdoor pool was AMAZING but for $350/night we were expecting more than what I would equate to a motel room.
The room was triangle-shaped, and the bathroom was so limited that the sink was located in the guestroom portion rather than in the bathroom. That's ghetto.

Airport shuttle was great.
Food was fantastic, although our server completely forgot about us because he was doubling as the bartender.
review.negativeRemarks: Get rid of the ghetto motel-style guestrooms. Sinks belong in the washroom. I would be embarassed of that guestroom if I ran that hotel.
review.locationRemarks: There is nothing to do near by, other than a 7-11. I wouldn't recomend this hotel to anyone who wasn't flying out of SFO immediately after.

review.title: Hotel is 20 min away from San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I fid not like the hotel as it differs from all Marriott i have stayed in. This could be rated at most a 3 star hotel.
When we arrived, the hotel staff gave us a rom in ground floor that smells too nad. We complained and they changed us to an unsmelly room.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel is less than my expectation on Marriott chain
review.negativeRemarks: To be more cleaner
review.locationRemarks: Location is ok if u dont wanna stay in downtown San Francisco, however u need to have a car as it takes 20 min to be there. SFO is 10 min away

review.title: Emergency Stay
review.reviewText: Ended up staying here due to an airport emergency. The hotel was wonderful and comfortable, but I think just a bit too much penny pinching. Charging for internet, charging for breakfast, charging for parking. When you pay really good money for a hotel (avg of $250/night) you shouldnt be having to pay for the things that should be included.
review.positiveRemarks: The room and property were great. Restaurant served really good food. You get what you pay for, just sometimes you have to pay even more.
review.negativeRemarks: Stop charging extra for things that should be included in your room rate.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to the Free way and Airport
review.reviewText: Terrible service and attitude at the reception. I had a request for double bed suite, receptionist said that you have a request but all sold. I mentioned to him about review of other people that they have same issue, so he bluntly said that why did you make reservation if you have seen the review. Also, I asked extra towel but cleaning person showed bad face impression. I am a business person and have lot of travelling but this time took my family with me. MY kids were in shock with the attitude of people.
review.negativeRemarks: service and free parking.
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: This was a really nice hotel. The staff was friendly and the rooms are clean. The only issue was the A/C didn't seem to be working very well.

review.title: Nice hotel not close to the beach
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel - the only drawback is that you can't walk to much during the weekends, so you are stuck driving to a restaurant or using the overpriced in0hotel restaurant.

review.title: For the money, I don't think it was great!
review.reviewText: They charge you for a big fancy hotel...but that was not my experience. I was hot the first night. I set up the room and they maid service kept on putting things back. I don't get it. The wallpaper was coming off the walls and they put me in a handicapped room when I did not ask for one. What if someone checked in and needed it?
review.positiveRemarks: Location was close to where I needed to be.

review.title: nice hotel outside but not in
review.reviewText: had one night stay but couldn't sleep well at all with unbelievably noisy from noise the aisle as result of poor sound-proof code near elevator; and since there's no free wi-fi offered except lobby area, it is packed in the lobby for wi-fi using.
review.negativeRemarks: make an improvement of building code
review.locationRemarks: visiting friends

review.title: $22 for parking¬°
review.reviewText:
Can't believe it, 22$ for parking in a suburban hotel.

Deluxe room was fantastic. Overall hotel was very nice, but you need to factor in the parking rate. Oh and of course there was a charge for internet.
review.negativeRemarks: Desk check should give a map so you know which enhance its closest to your room.

review.title: Roomy, Very clean & Comfortable
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very nice and beautifully decorated. The rooms are spacious, clean and very comfortable. The staff was friendly and ready to help you with whatever you needed. I happened to forget my toothbrush, and they supplied me with brush and toothpaste. We have stayed here twice now. Once to attend our sons master's degree graduation, and the other to attend the birth of his child. We really like the hotel and have only one complaint. They charge 22.00 for parking per day. If it was in the city where parking is a premium, I could understand it. But they have a huge piece of property with parking everywhere. The only reason I can see to charge the extra fee is greed. The rooms are pretty pricey, but when you add the daily parking fee to it, it's just too much.
We will probably be looking into another hotel for our next visit.
review.positiveRemarks: How spacious and beautifully decorated it was. The beds are very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't charge for parking. Its sort of an insult to your guests.
review.locationRemarks: Family.

review.title: Unexpected Awful & unpleasant experience!!!
review.reviewText: Problems since I got to check in. They told me my request for double beds was. It possible for the suite I booked in. Only I king bed available. The manager said "do you want it or not". The staff is not courteous at all. They would not show up when asked to bring something to room and they would deny taking the request. Then they tried to charge me for parking when I was not required to do so when I first checked in. The only good thing about this place is the state of rooms. Very clean but other than that I've had much more quality service at other hotels. First and last for me at a Marriott!
review.negativeRemarks: Rude staff
review.locationRemarks: Expect to drive about 40 mins to downtown San Francisco locations.

review.title: Great hotel with Family and Friends.
review.reviewText: The experience was awesome. I would definitely recomend this hotel to my family, friends and co-workers. The staff was very friendly and knowledgable.
review.negativeRemarks: n/a
review.locationRemarks: San Mateo Marriott, this hotel is near the freeway.

review.title: Not as special as the price tag
review.reviewText: sprawling generic buildings on grounds without much charm. overpriced but clean, well kept, and comfortable. just not worth what they are charging. right next to a freeway interchange and a dumpy office park. the place almost seems like it should be a best western or some other generic budget chain and is just overpolished with some "high end" touches to try to make the price seem semi reasonable - hint: it doesn't work.

review.title: Nice Hotel well located close to downtown
review.reviewText: Stay was nice and close to local attractions. However, housekeeping missed cleaning the room one day. Also, the local hockey team is in the Playoffs and the game was not available on TV either in the room nor at the bar in the lobby. Problem was the Hotel is not subscribed to certain local cable, which is odd for a hotel chain this size.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice location in a nice/clean part of town.
review.negativeRemarks: Hostess and concierge appeared not from the area and could not advise on local directions. Good thing I had my Siri..
review.locationRemarks: Nice clean location in nice part of town. Downtown shopping and local bars 5-10 minute taxi ride.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: We feel for the price of Food and room it was very expensive
review.negativeRemarks: price

review.title: AMAZING HOTEL!!! But REALLY expensive parking!
review.reviewText:
AMAZING, very well kept hotel, excellent cleanliness, lots of amenities such as 2 gyms, swimming pool and spa, both with handicapped lift chairs, convention center, caf√© an restaurant.

I would definitely rate this hotel as 5 for everything, except for the $25 per day charge for parking. It's not San Francisco and there's lots of space. No reason for that!

Other than this ABSURD of price for parking, all is great!
review.negativeRemarks: $25 PARKING PER DAY!!!
review.locationRemarks: Great for the San Mateo area, especially the convention center.

review.title: Will they charge me per towel I use next?
review.reviewText:
This hotel charges you $22 for parking per day plus $12.95 per day PER DEVICE for wi-fi. I have stayed at other Marriott's where these were complimentary. There were plastic water bottles on the desk full of "pure water" for $5 each. The seemingly reasonable room rate is disguised in these amenity charges.
The layout of the hotel wings was very confusing and I have an excellent sense of direction.
The staff was very friendly. Everyone greeted us in the hallways.
review.negativeRemarks: Charge per day per device for wi-fi
review.locationRemarks: convenient location to freeway

review.title: Bring your nickels and dimes
review.reviewText: I recently watched a CNBC segment on Mariott in which an economist working for the company explained how they're attempting to "maximize revenue" and that he can't sleep "knowing we've left any money on the table." That is what the experience at this Mariott felt like: A hotel chasing profit rather than providing high-grade hospitality to their guests. Wifi? An extra $10 an hour. Parking? $22, and pay again if you leave the lot at any point during the day. Mariott is quickly becoming the US Airways of hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: Mariott: The US Airways of Hotels

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText:
Only a one night stop over but it was clean, comfortable and very spacious.
Nice place!

review.title: Excellent Hotel, but EXPENSIVE parking...
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, clean, well kept, excellent Jacuzzi and Swimming Pool, 2 or more rooms with gym equipment, my only complaint would be their parking charge... $22 a day?!?!?! OUCH!!! All else is fine... however... VERY EXPENSIVE PARKING!!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Location close to Convention Center and amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: PARKING PRICE!!!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for the Convention Center

review.title: Good, but WI no FI?
review.reviewText: Liked the hotel, but it was very annoying that wifi was not included for free.
review.positiveRemarks: The bar and general atmosphere of the hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Have to pay extra for wifi

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: We love staying At this upscale hotel.The rooms are big, the suites are great and the breakfast is perfect!

review.title: Awesome hotel!
review.reviewText: The San Mateo Marriot never ceases to amaze me. The staff is very nice, the room is very clean, and they always seem to go beyond what I expect. We've always been treated very nicely when we stay at this hotel. Every time I make a reservation, I don't have to worry about whether I made the right hotel choice because I've always had a good experience when I stay at this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed. The pillows are very comfortable.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Really good and comfortable. Clean and complies any expectation.
review.negativeRemarks: Some noise from the highway
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: great quality hotel
review.reviewText: Very comfortable, very clean, very friendly staff.

review.title: Good time
review.reviewText: Very nice and clean, a few loud people heard them there the walls

review.title: Pleasant Stay -
review.reviewText: A little farther than I would have liked from Airport and a little pricey. Overall, the hotel was fine. Clean. I checked in at 11pm and the front desk was empty and 3 people in line. There was also some kind of kid event that weekend so lots of teenagers running around in the lobby. Overall the hotel was fine.
review.negativeRemarks: More staff during late hours would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: A little farther than I would have liked from SFO.

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: This was a very nice hotel. I would tell anyone who did not have a car to stay here. I did not realize that there was a charge for parking here. Other then that it was fabulous.

review.title: Perfect to travelers
review.reviewText: This Hotel is near less than 10 min away from SFO. Easy to find and get to. An older Hotel but has been updated. The staff was very nice and helpful and let us know about available upgrades. I would stay here again. Very nice for the price.

review.title: Two major room setup flaws
review.reviewText:
The room would have been 100 % perfect but for two details.
1. Who decided it was a good idea to have the coffee brewing set up in the bathroom, just about 3 yards from the toilet? The most ridiculous thing I've seen. Needless to say we moved it -- onto the small bedside table, because there were no usable electric outlets by the bigger tables.
2. Who decided it was a good idea to have the fully loaded towel rack inside the bathtub area, facing the shower head? Even theoretically it seems to be a splash zone, but I tried showering very carefully yet the towels did get wet before I had a chance to use them. Was the same person involved in both decisions? If so, it's high time Marriott finds someone better.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee and towel rack setup

review.title: A comfortable hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our recent stay at the San Mateo Marriott hotel. The hotel itself is clean, the service very good, and the rooms are comfortable, although there was no fridge or wineglasses supplied. We ordered room service on the first night which was very quick and tasty. The hotel is quite a distance from San Francisco centre - the Caltrain station is a 15 minute walk away, and then a 35 minute train ride, and a 20 minute muni ride to the city centre, so it is not particularly easy to access by public transport.
review.negativeRemarks: distance from central San Francisco

review.title: Best hotel for the convention center!
review.reviewText: Definately a confortabel and good stay.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: We stayed there for one night only, we didn't realize the room's air conditioning was not working at all until next morning. It was uncomfortable throughout the night and very hot / uncomfortable in the morning before we checked out.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights. The hotel staff gave our extended family room near us which was convenient. Our room was very comfortable and quiet. Entering from the hallway, there was a large seating area with a door that separated it from the bedroom area. It made it extremely quiet so my husband could sleep if I wanted to stay up and watch TV. Maid service was outstanding-very prompt with attention to detail. Staff were helpful. On site restaurant was a bit pricey, but the portions were huge so a salad or sandwich could easlily be shared. Very ample parking and very little noise with vehichles coming and going near bedroom window. We were very pleased with out hotel stay.

review.title: $20/day to park
review.reviewText:
The hotel's mazelike parking lot is not the easiest to navigate. Adding a hefty per-day fee to park the rental car at a hotel that's 7 miles from the airport is a bit tacky. The room was nice enough, good Marriott quality. It's walking distance to the San Mateo County Fairgrounds. The location right off of 2 major freeways makes it easy to get to, and I don't recall road noise being a problem.

In all, it is an OK hotel. If I need to stay near the San Mateo County Fairgrounds again, I'd consider it.

review.title: San Mateo
review.reviewText: The room was clean and beautifully decorated. The odor that met us at the door to the room was repulsive. After we turned the air off and opened the window, this was alleviated. It is a good thing we did not need AC or heat during our stay, that smell was atrocious.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for completing the review on our hotel.  We appreciate your compliments and are glad that we were just what you needed.  We hope to accommodate you again in the future.

review.title: Served the Purpose
review.reviewText: This is a nice facility with good access to the freeway. If that's what you want, and I did, that's what you get.

review.title: Great value and comfort
review.reviewText: Second time staying here and it is still a wonderful, convenient place to stay. When we arrived, they offered us the choice of top floor or ground floor. The suite appeared clean although there was some minor stains on the shower tile. When we returned to the room the second afternoon after running around the city, we noticed that a 1 foot by 2 foot section of wall paper had peeled away from the wall. We notified the staff and they immediately set us up in another room. The second suite was impeccable and comfortable. The pool and workout facilities are very clean. I would definitely go here again.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Once inside the facility, I was extremely impressed with the size of the rooms, quality of towels, bedding, TV's. The room did not have a microwave, but they brought one for us to use. Was there 8 days for a conference and sightseeing. Only thing I was NOT pleased with was the frequency of the complementary shuttle. We missed our shuttle and had to wait an hour for the next one, so we missed our guided tour because the BART schedule did not coorilate with the hotel shuttle. Everything seemed to be, hurry, hurry, hurry up and wait a long time. Parking was so expensive in San Fransisco, we chose to use public transportation. While waiting for our hotel shuttle, there were some hotel shuttles that had come 8 more times before ours even came by. Area around the hotel was a little scarey out back, but they had good locked doors with key pad access. While out there, you could hear a loud drunk walking the sidewalk just singing away happily. A pretty fence would have been nice back there, but overall, I felt safe at all times. The front of the hotel looks out over the big highway, not too scenic, but okay. Meeting rooms were nice and spacious, Service was outstanding by all. Check in and out was slow due to the high volume of customers checking in and out. Whatever you do, make sure you bring your money. Everything cost and is expensive, especially in their resturaunt. I would have loved to stay longer if I had the time or money.

review.title: San Mateo Birthday Holiday
review.reviewText:
San Mateo Marriott really delivered! It has all the amenities it promised, from the complimentary airport shuttle service, to the reception, to the hotel room, and the amenities insdie the hotel. Even the food in the restaurant was good (I loved the chicken quesadilla, the minestrone soup - the tastiest and freshest minestrone soup I've had in a long time, and the Penne Vodka Pasta) - kudos to the chef!

The only thing lacking was a refrigerator inside the room; I was expecting that. It only had a bucket that you can use to fetch ice from the hallway.

review.title: Great Hotel Near Airport
review.reviewText: Check-in and out was very quick and service was courteous. There were so many amenities, I didn't have time to use them all. My room was spotless, clean, and comfortable. My only complaint was with having to pay $18/day to park my car, and no free internet service. But that is a small complaint in comparison to what I got for the price I paid. Would definitely recommend.

review.title: Satisfied Customer and would go back
review.reviewText: Over all I had a good flight to and from my destination. The fare was 'okay' given I scheduled my flight the day before (I think it was a bit too pricey thought). I was very satisfied with my hotel and the hotel service. I was very pleased with my hotel room and would surely recommend it to others.

review.title: Great room, great price
review.reviewText: The room was great and spacious. Service was even better. We didn't have a refrigerator and requested one, which was brought up immediately. My husband wanted to watch ESPN2 and noticed that there was a problem with the cable. They fixed it immediately! We had a car so driving to downtown San Mateo was no problem. If you want to spend the day in Half Moon Bay, this hotel is worth saving 50% on your hotel bill and driving to the beach.

review.title: Great hotel, but not well-suited for travel into San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice, but I would not stay again for the type of travel we wanted to do over the weekend. The shuttle from the airport (SFO) to the hotel stops running by 9:30 pm. We came in on a late flight from Hawaii and waited an hour for the shuttle which didn't arrive (even though we called the hotel at 9:10 pm when we arrived at SFO, they failed to mention that minor detail. Also, we wanted to take BART into the City for the day. If you plan on going into San Francisco without your own vehicle, this hotel is not a good choice. The nearest BART station is at SFO and the shuttle from the hotel to SFO was running every hour. It was also about $8.00 per person to take BART one-way into the City which adds up quickly for a family. The hotel itself was nice enough and the rate was very reasonable -- our problem was with the location and times we wanted to travel. If you do not plan to travel into the City, are not arriving late or leaving early from SFO, then it works out quite well. Plus the beds are wonderful!

review.title: CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK
review.reviewText: Let me say that this hotel is fully loaded. I have stayed at 4 star many times but the accommodations here is wonderful. The staff is kind and friendly.Nothing beats the modern design of the rooms. The small touches on the rooms like in flat screen and the safe are out of sight. The colors are warm and welcoming! I would never recommend to anyone anything less than this hotel. Clean and prompt. The house cleaners are kind and very helpful as well as trained on every detail of presentation. Funny that I am writing this review because I stayed in a hotel one a day before and the cleanliness of the room was unmatched. Both hotels where at the same rating. But I would I recommend you to say here! Truly excellent!

review.title: I'll be back
review.reviewText: The hotel is extremely well maintained and the rooms are clean. The restaurants offer a varied menu and appetizing dishes. Staff members are always helpful and polite.

review.title: Enjoy the time in hotel
review.reviewText: I like this hotel because it's the one I expected. It has good condition, nice environment and convenient parking. I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

review.title: A great find for a quick trip
review.reviewText: Obviously a popular hotel for weddings. There were at least 4 gatherings that I could see. The grounds were beautiful and the staff very courteous. We did eat at the restaurant the 1st night of our 2 night stay. We were a little scared since our party of 7 were the only ones there. The menu offered was what you would find in a fine dining establishement. The presentation was fine, but unfortuantely the food and service were not. The breakfast buffet was a bit pricey, but the service and quality of the food did make up for the previous night's dinner. The only other comment I would have is they need to re-think the logistics of the parking gate. Very confusing. I thought it was just us, but each person that pulled up experienced the same.

review.title: Nice hotel but very spread out and bad parking system
review.reviewText: The Hotel is on a large property and long walk to get to the restaurant and front desk. Also they charge for parking and have a new security sytem to battle each time you drive in or out of the property. I suggested they simply charge more for the room and forget about trying to keep track of who has or has not paid for parking. The system is so confusing that I had to help several guests that were at the exit gate. It takes two or three times to understand how to swipe the card to get past the security gate. What a Pain.

review.title: Great food
review.reviewText: The food at San Mateo Hotel was fantastic. They have excellent choices and wide variety.

review.title: Parking Cost
review.reviewText: I thought an $18.00 overnight parking fee was excessive especially since its self park. Just like the airlines charging for bags and blankets - just another way to stiff customers. I'll be choosing another hotel next time.

review.title: Nice experience
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, very large! No mini fridge in the room unless you ask to have one brought up. No vending machines for drinks or snacks. No fans in bathrooms. Overall, besides getting lost going to our room on a daily basis, we had a pleasant stay.

review.title: Good place. No free wifi.
review.reviewText: Extremely nice decor and comfort. Super nice staff. Decent rates. Internet access should be free, but isn't. Only one restaurant and it is too expensive. Nothing else much in walking distance.

review.title: Absoloutly loved it
review.reviewText: this is a 4 star hotel, you won't be dissapointed as long as you are ok with where it's located. extremely CLEAN, and nice too. Comfort is actually the thing that will take me back to this hotel.

review.title: San Mateo
review.reviewText: Nice, clean, comfy hotel.

review.title: Would go there again
review.reviewText: We stayed here on New Years Eve after attending a dinner dance in San Mateo. Hotel was only 3 minutes away, very convenient. Some noise late in the evening because of New Year's Eve (was expected). Very nice.

review.title: happy customer
review.reviewText: very courteous staff. given handicapped suite due to elderly member of the party. only problem is parking which cost $16 daily for self-park and $20 for valet parking. close to restaurant and the freeway. shuttle to and from airport on the half hour. Internet in the lobby is free.

review.title: Not Really an Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a great property but it is about 15 minutes from the airport. This property is not on the airport exit.

review.title: Glad we found this hotel
review.reviewText: We moved from another hotel down the street when the power went out, and this was such a nice surprise! Great hotel with many conveniences in very nice lobby (including Starbucks) and the friendliest girl at check-in who helped with extra blankets and a wake up call. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Weekend Getaway---Good overall stay
review.reviewText: Suite was excellent except that the bed was too soft for my taste. Everything else was fine. Employees were friendly. Marriott needs to discontinue the parking charge on weekends, since there is nowhere to go without a car it the hotel's location, especially with the economy the way it is. You would attract more locals.

review.title: Very nice.
review.reviewText: Good breakfast buffet. Very nice staff

review.title: stay experience can be improved
review.reviewText: there was no microwave in the room or free breakfast. barring that, the stay was comfortable.

review.title: Quality hotel near the airport
review.reviewText: Comfortable hotel with pool. Good sized rooms, well maintained. My room faced away from the 101 highway but check this. Business office centre nearby but not much in the way of eating places other than the hotel.

review.title: Highly Recommend
review.reviewText: This Marriot was a great stay. The rooms were very nice and super clean. Beds very comfortable. The breakfast was fantastic. Made to order omlets, everything else you could want, and amazing fruit. Have paid $20 dollars for breakfasts in other hotels that weren't half as good!

review.title: Good Hotel...Bad Staff...
review.reviewText: Front desk rude...!

review.title: Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: This Marriott is not cheap, but the facilities are well kept, the rooms in very good shape and the staff very courteous and accommodating.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Not bad for a night in transit, but the hotel is dated and my room smelled heavily of male sweat. The bed was clean and comfortable. Bill padding, e.g. large amount of onsite parking requiring additional payment, with few viable alternative options, more than a little mercenary!

review.title: Bad parking n biz practice. Good facilities with known name brand.
review.reviewText: I would say this hotel is great for its room overall, balancing out its room quality, tidiness and maintenance (which is not very good). However I felt upset when I found out at checkout that they do charge $16 per day for self parking at the hotel where no other businesses near by even need a gate for their parking. And there is no alternatives for parking except on side streets at the residential streets close to the hotel. They said everyone else (hotels) near the airport charges parking. But they are 4 miles off the SFO airport. Also, no one tells me at check in and other places except on a sign at the parking gate at the less obvious place. I felt like I am being asked to pay for a meal on a 15 hours flight without advance notice which you don't have much choice at the moment. Talking to the manager to complain only yield one day waived parking out of the 3 days stay. I didn't take the offer since I dont' think it is right biz practice and the one day charge isn't really that significant. That left a very bad impression at check out to say the least.

review.title: Weekend Getaway
review.reviewText: I have stayed here multiple times and the experience has always been excellent. Reserved the executive suite with breakfast, which was very good. Room was very comfortable and quiet. Note: Free parking on weekends would probably entice more locals .

review.title: Perfect for adults and family
review.reviewText: WE loved staying here. My son and I shared the Executive suite and my sister and her family stayed in the "Loft" room. It was a fun place to stay. The staff were excellent and the room service employees were lovely, bending over backwards to please us. There was a full bar in the lobby and the bartender made the perfect Gimlet. I was very impressed. It might be expensive for some but that wasn't an issue for me, convenience was.

review.title: Very impressed. Met or exceeded all needs.
review.reviewText: Needed to be there original stay (3/19/09) hotel and staff were very curtious and accomodating. Had to return one month later (4/16/09) for same issue and the hotel went above and beyond expectations. Staff was curtious, accomodating, helpful, the room was very clean. Highly recommend staying for any reason.

review.title: overall okay
review.reviewText: front desk service outstanding - we were listened to attentively and treated with great respect. our first room was properly cleaned and we were moved immediately to another room. room service was very prompt but one of our orders was not delivered - again rectified with very quick service but we were disappointed that we were charged an additional room service delivery charge - we believe that we should have been given the second meal on a complimentary basis. the restaurant in the hotel delivered outstanding food and drinks - very happy with that. the comfort of the bed was above and beyond expectation - we both had an awesome sleep! overall this stay was okay.

review.title: Almost a decent place to stay
review.reviewText: I can see what the hotel is TRYING to do... but the bartender was rude. The smell of pot was heavy in the hall as I made my way to my room. The room itself smelled like body odor. There was a pubic hair of some sort on the bed. However, The room service food was great. The person that answered the room service request was great. the quality of the bed, linens and sundries were excellent. Quality of the TV was good. Checking in and out was easy. The fitness facility was clean with good equipment - although a couple of the treadmills were inoperable.

review.title: Don't expect any service
review.reviewText: The hotel has decent amenities, but don't expect any service from them. If you are lucky, you'll get house keeping service.. We didn't receive one.

review.title: nice hotel but small rooms
review.reviewText: This is a very nice and clean hotel. Restaurant has an excellent but pricey breakfast buffet. Rooms were neat and clean. Had HD Plasma TV's in both rooms. Living area had sofa bed for kids which was an added touch. I was disappointed with the size of the room. I expected a suite with 2 separate areas. However, there was just a glass wall with see-thru curtains separating the living room from bedroom. Suite was very small. I also didn't like the idea of having to pay additional per day to park. I don't remember seeing this cost in any Expedia documentation. I wouldn't stay there again with kids.

review.title: Close to SFO, great price
review.reviewText: Very helpful front desk staff.

review.title: Nice hotel, not much around it
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is very nice and the staff was pleasant and helpful. The biggest drawback was location. There is a mall a short drive away, but few places to go otherwise or sit down and eat. The surrounding area left a bit to be desired. Drive in to San Francisco was manageable but traffic made it frustrating. Close to airport, but not right next door. Seems like an odd place to put such a nice hotel.

review.title: VERY CLEAN HOTEL BUT SMALL ROOMS
review.reviewText: This is a very nice and clean hotel. Restaurant has an excellent but pricey breakfast buffet. Rooms were neat and clean. Had HD Plasma TV's in both rooms. Living area had sofa bed for kids which was an added touch. I was disappointed with the size of the room. I expected a suite with 2 separate areas. However, there was just a glass wall with see-thru curtains separating the living room from bedroom. Suite was very small. I also didn't like the idea of having to pay additional per day to park. I don't remember seeing this cost in any Expedia documentation. I wouldn't stay there again with kids.

review.title: Not too happy
review.reviewText: We checked in at 900 pm. We drove our car and asked for parking info. The receptionist was happy enough to bill us, but failed to let us know the nearest parking spot to our room. Going to our room was a long roundabout. Even though there was a desk and 1 chair, there was no place to put our snacks on, unlike some hotels that provide a small sitting area. I'm not going back to that hotelif I can help it.

review.title: Loved the accomodations
review.reviewText: This is a very high quality hotel with very friendly and helpful staff I booked the Concierge room and was more than pleased with the breakfast etc included There is also a complemetary shuttle service to and from the airport. Heated pool, hot tub ... I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone

review.title: Great for what we needed, except for one detail
review.reviewText: We needed a suite to accomodate two small children, and the Marriott had a perfect setup with a separate bedroom (king sized bed) and living room with a sofabed. The bathroom was also huge, which is nice when you have 4 people sharing it. Our only less-than-satisfactory experience was when we requested a crib, and it took them almost 10 hours to deliver it to the room, after 3 callbacks. The front desk reps were friendly and responsive, but that responsiveness did not translate downstream to the people actually fulfilling the request.

review.title: Very poor experience
review.reviewText: The rooms were pretty nice, but nothing special for the price and location. Two of the front desk staff were rude and unhelpful. I was there for a large conference. The food quality was poor. They had one bartender for a social with 200+ people. The public restrooms on levels one and two were out of order for most of the conference. Charging $10 a day for a slow Internet connection so last millenium. You even have to pay to check e-mail in the business center. No restaurants or shopping within walking distance. I'll never stay there again.

review.title: Inconsiderate people can bring any hotel down the rating scale
review.reviewText: Room was very nice and well appointed. One night of our stay was particularly unwelcoming. Unfortunately, guests from an affair that was being held at the hotel were less than refined (I am being very polite) and did not mind smoking and making noise in the halls (of course the air flow then pulled the smoke under our door and those of other guests. How nice.) Got to love those smokers. Smelling like a dirty ashtray was not my intent when I checked into the hotel. Also, if you want hot coffee, go to the nearby 7-11, because you will not find any at breakfast, unless you bring a portable microwave with you. Almost forgot, the outlet in my room was not properly anchored/wired and blew the fuse and left us without electric one morning. I need to remember to bring my toolbox next time (Exaggerated a bit, but you get my point. Minor inspection should have easily caught that. Could have been a real problem for those with little children, as well as huge liability for the hotel.) The hotel desk could have done more and been more timely in their response to matters.

review.title: Good but...
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was gorgeous, the bed was brilliantly comfortable, and almost all the staff were lovely. The front desk staff was not as helpful (ie telling us there were no restaurants in the area when there was one only a 5 minute walk away), although all of the servers and the cleaning staff were friendly and on top of things. I also thought that charging what they charge for internet access was a bit excessive for a hotel which was already far from cheap...

review.title: Very comfortable, I would go back
review.reviewText: This hotel is very clean and comfortable. Make sure you have a room away from the main doors. Possibly in the second floor or so. If you don't mind paying a little extra to get more comfort, then I would do it. The staff is very very helpful.

review.title: NIce hotel with easy access to highways
review.reviewText: Very clean room. Good price.

review.title: Near Airport - Clean Nice Hotel - Starbucks onsite
review.reviewText: We wanted to stay close to the airport for an early morning flight. This hotel was the right choice, good choices for dining around hotel. Starbucks in lobby. We will definitely consider staying at this hotel again.

review.title: San Mateo -- California
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel and outstanding service. Very friendly and efficient staff

review.title: Very comfortable beds and extremely quiet room-slept great
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean with excellent customer service. Plenty of parking. The beds were the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in at a hotel. We ordered room service and although it was a bit pricey, it was very good and the service was fast.

review.title: Excellent rooms..
review.reviewText: This was my first trip to San Francisco. The courtesy shuttle from the airport to the hotel was an easy way to get there at night. Also the Hertz rental booth located on site was an excellent way to get a car without having to worry about pick-up and drop off. We enjoyed our stay in the hotel and would definitely go back there next time.

review.title: Best choose
review.reviewText: it is the best hotel to recommond

review.title: very clean and nice hotel to stay
review.reviewText: stayed for 2 nights; room was very clean and bed materials were like brand new!;only minor complaint is that bathroom was a bit small, but overall condition of the room was better than most of 4 star Las Vegas hotel rooms!!!

review.title: very comfortable
review.reviewText: we stayed in a 1 bedroom suite. It was very comfortable. It would be have been great except that there was not shampoo when in the bathroom when we checked in and the sheets in the pull out couch had not been changed. The staff at the desk was minimally helpful. The housekeeping staff did do an excellent job the next day in cleaning the room.

review.title: wonderful place to stay
review.reviewText: clean atmosphere, excellent and friendly service

review.title: Good News: Beautiful hotel and grounds. Bad New paid parking, no complimentary Breakfast
review.reviewText: Disappointments: no complimentary coffee of breakfast in the lobby, paid for parking - cost was too high, fee for high speed internest - should be no cost, plastic door key to enter building did not work properly - but was ok to get into hotel room

review.title: Have already recommended to friends
review.reviewText: This hotel seems to have been recently renovated, with great amenities. I just would like to advise future travelers to this location that parking is not complimentary).

review.title: It was ok
review.reviewText: Our key didn't work to get in parking area. Had to call for help. Again, coming out, key would not open gate. Had to go in and re-key. They did take off the 14.00 parking charge which was nice. I'd give it another try, but not right away, I'd try another hotel to compare. The room itself was very nice.

review.title: Unexpected LUXURY
review.reviewText: What a lovely hotel. I was amazed at the renovations. The lobby and resturaunt were so inviting, but the room knocked my socks off. Huge - and no I didn't have a suite - and decadent. The only thing better than the room, was the service throughout the hotel. The staff was consistantly attentative and truly personable. It was a pleasure to stay there, and I look forward to returning.

review.title: Parking fee is shocker
review.reviewText: I liked everything but pay attention to $14/day parking fee. This hotel in San Mateo not San Francisco where you need to pay $14 for parking. Near San Mateo downtown plenty of food and shops around about 1 to 2 miles.

review.title: very convenient, excellent choice
review.reviewText: very convenient, close to airport and downtown San Francisco, good express check-out in early morning hours.

review.title: Excellent in the San Mateo Area
review.reviewText: Stayed at the San Mateo Marriott twice in the Summer of 2006, and went back in March 2007 and was pleasantly surprised that the carpets and interior was re-done. Carpets were new, bath/shower remodeled, as well as, other interior spaces renewed.

review.title: Very Pleased
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with all aspects of my visit to the Marriot San Mateo.

review.title: Enjoyed our Time
review.reviewText: Everything was very nice we would go back. Nice to be close to San Francisco but not in the city. The airport lost our lugguage and it was delived to the hotel but no one wrote it down so it was a little of a mix up but because of it they didn't charge us for 4 days of parking. Hertz rental cars at hotel which is great.

review.title: Very comfortable and clean....
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean inside and out.....highly recommend

review.title: front desk was not impressive.
review.reviewText: check in process was delayed and i was not informed until almost 2 hours passed.

review.title: Good hotel to stay with comfort
review.reviewText: service is good, room is very comfortable. most of all, economical price for 4 star hotel.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: I have stayed here 3 or 4 times and have generally found it be more than acceptable. Location is convenient to Hwy 101, although freeway is relatively close so not exactly a scenic outdoor area. No traffic noise, however. My last visit was a big, negative surprise. I had requested early check-in but was rather rudely put off by desk clerk upon arrival (my colleague got a room; I was told to wait) and ended up having to wait almost 2 hours to get a room--and at that, I had to go back and insist that they had by now moved past the regular check-in time and still no room was available. A different clerk was actually very helpful and apologetic. So, maybe it was just one employee, but it was very unprofessional and off-putting. The rooms themselves are well-kept and clean. Good high speed internet access for $10/day.

review.title: Very good value
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to everything and is very big,quiet, the room is very comfy. would recommened it to anybody visiting north cal

review.title: Excellent Service
review.reviewText: Excellent service, even past midnight when I checked in. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was excellent and at a very reasonable price. Centrally located in San Mateo. I left some packages in my room and the staff returned my calls promptly and had my packages shipped out to me.

review.title: Very nice place for busniess travelers
review.reviewText: This is one of Marriotts nicer business friendly properties. Nice restaurant; have the breakfast burrito, really.

review.title: Your staff did a wonderful job, even when things got rushed with our big group converging on the restaurant all at once.  Pleasant, delightful and efficient.  We very much enjoyed our stay.
review.reviewText: The place is so beautiful, and we couldn't hear other people, or the airplanes going into SFO nearby.  Cozy, comfortable, roomy.  Thanks for a very nice stay.
